body: @ulwfcyvi Thanks for your question. I am still interested in this issue. Could I know why you want to use ShardingSphere with cockroachDB?  Thanks?
Hi, @zBo1997 which version do you use? I presume the relevant issue was fixed already. Could you search these keywords in closed PRs? I guess you will get some hints.

Hi which version does this issue mention? @Lychengit 
@yx9o Sure, welcome.
@HeroHong Thanks for your feedback. Could you check this issue on our master branch? Does this issue still exist there?
@marker-wu Sure, we are working on this feature, which includes the distributed mode.
Hi @qiuxiaotong2021 Appreciated your ideas, I will discuss your issue with the community and update you then.

Hi  your case, i.e, `bindTables` exist in the same instance, so I think `foreign key` works.
But once tables locates in different instances, I guess we need a huge work. What do you think? @yanghaoyu
Hi @CodingBingo @dbin0123 Thanks for your comments here. @CodingBingo 's idea looks interesting. @strongduanmu Please give a close attention to this issue.
Appreciate your immediate reply. i got some hints

@448700174 Thanks for your question and answer. ;-)
Which version do you use?

Hi which version? @YollinChan 
@TeslaCN

> @ulwfcyvi Thanks for your question. I am still interested in this issue. Could I know why you want to use ShardingSphere with cockroachDB? Thanks?

Because our cockroachDB query is slow, someone asked me to try ShardingSphere with cockroachDB. I think ShardingSphere is not suitable for cockroachDB. Because cockroachDB is a distributed database. What do you think?

> What is the useful with ShardingSphere and cockroachDB?

Because our cockroachDB query is slow, someone asked me to try ShardingSphere with cockroachDB. I think ShardingSphere is not suitable for cockroachDB. Because cockroachDB is a distributed database. What do you think?

@CodingBingo It looks a little strange. From my point, if users configure single tables in the configuration, these single tables are likely to be applied to these default strategies, e.g., `defaultKeyGenerateStrategy`. On the other hand, when ShardingSphere automatically loads single tables, which means they are really single tables (configured single tables approximately are viewed as one-shard sharding tables). In this case, database auto-increment property fits them.
How do you think?
@qiuxiaotong2021 So if it was fixed, could you close this issue?

@zJiaJun Hi thanks for your feedback, it looks this bug-fix will be included in the incoming release, right?
@strongduanmu
@tristaZero 5.0.0-beta
Hi @CodingBingo Could I have your WeChat connection? If it's possible, I am waiting for your response in my email (panjuan@apache.org). ;-)
Is it a bug or not?

@tristaZero Single tables and  sharding tables exist in a database at the same time.  I configured the sharding tables configuration. do not configure single tables.

![1631444290(1)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/90435449/132984972-c50127a3-7324-4df8-98a4-dd07cf39b5e3.png)

The current Maven configuration is（Latest version）：
       <dependency>
            <groupId>org.apache.shardingsphere</groupId>
            <artifactId>shardingsphere-jdbc-core</artifactId>
            <version>5.0.0-beta</version>
        </dependency>
Solved, closed.
